etymology.description: 江(江) (jiāng, "river") and 山(山) (shān, "mountain") together create the meaning of the country's natural landscape or the country as a whole.
etymology.interpretation: 江山(江山) (jiāngshān, "landscape; country") metaphorically represents the country or nation by highlighting its natural features of rivers and mountains, which have historically been pivotal in defining and defending territories in China.

examples.chinese: 江山如此多娇(江山如此多嬌)。
他保护江山(他保護江山)，像守护自己的命根子(像守護自己的命根子)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎohù jiāngshān, xiàng shǒuhù zìjǐ de mìnggēnzǐ.
examples.english: He protects his country as if guarding his own lifeline.
